pullrequest.title: Proposal: scoping rules, allow everything to use //pose[@relative_to]

content.raw:
> we're saying `//collision/pose` can access frame names defined in the model scope, which is outside of it's most immediate scope

it's true that the model scope it outside of its most immediate scope as we usually define it (between siblings), but since this proposal isn't including `//link/frame` and we haven't defined implicit frames for any children of a link (collision, visual, etc), the collision has no implicit or explicit frames in its immediate scope. I think the idea is to let it go up in parent scopes recursively until the first defined frames are found and stop there
